data.title: 2015 Malbec, Solana Vineyard, Paso Robles AVA — Turiya Wines
data.meta_description: Does wine ever remind you of a place? Well, this wine is Coachella; Woodstock for the hippie crowd… It’s an experience you don’t want to miss. One that you know gets better every year. It’s historical; it’s funky, earthy, and expressive. Doused in flavors of briar-fruit and tootsie-roll. Express you
data.text:
Turiya Wines 6th Vintage

Harvest Date: September 1st, 2015

100% Solana Vineyard, Paso Robles AVA

Brix 22.2

13.2% Alc. PH 3.52

5 day cold soak 14 day low temperature, natural fermentation

Soft press, separating free run from pressed juice.

44 month barrel aging, one time used French Oak barrels.

Un-fined, unfiltered.

Hand bottled, hand waxed. 24k gold screen-printed bottles. Signed by the Winemaker.

Drinking window: now through 2025

A little extra:

The last time I made a Malbec was in 2009 so one might say ‘it’s about damn time’ I did one again. Bear in mind, I only produced one barrel as 100% Malbec for this 2015 vintage - so this is definitely not going to be around for too long and I don’t have any more Malbec being released for the next several years (nothing in barrel as of now). Malbec is one of the grapes I fell in love with early on and it has always had a special place in my heart! Cheers!
